content: for pattern support please go to the questions thread here 1 a little gift to say **thank you** from the bottom of my heart - happy knitting these arm warmers wrist warmers cuff muffs or however you want to call them will keep your arms toasty …they are a lovely addition to every short or ¾ sleeve shirt or even a top done in pure british hampshire yarn the combination of the fairy lace pattern and the rustic style of the yarn make them special and so cute to keep the knitting easy and relaxed all shaping is achieved by using different needle sizes yarn the little grey sheep british hampshire yarn 4ply 229 yards 210 m / 50g 1 skein shown in natural grey undyed needles us 2½ 3 mm dpns or preferred needle for working small circumferences in the round us 2 2 75 mm dpns or preferred needle for working small circumferences in the round us 1½ 2 5 mm dpns or preferred needle for working small circumferences in the round gauge 26 sts x 36 row = 4 x 4 10 x 10 cm in lace pattern on us 2½ 3 mm needle unblocked sizes one size fits most upper circumference 9 23 cm lower circumference 8 20 cm length 10 5 26 5 cm materials stitch marker tapestry needle blocking tools 1 https //www ravelry com/discuss/designs-by-isabell-kraemer/3632604/1-25
